<Link id="l00103" /><CodeLine lineNumber="103"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00104" /><CodeLine lineNumber="104"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// Additional information about basic blocks where the current variable is</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00105" /><CodeLine lineNumber="105"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// live. Such a block will look like one of these templates:</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00106" /><CodeLine lineNumber="106"><Highlight kind="comment">  ///</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00107" /><CodeLine lineNumber="107"><Highlight kind="comment">  ///  1 |   o---x   | Internal to block. Variable is only live in this block.</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00108" /><CodeLine lineNumber="108"><Highlight kind="comment">  ///  2 |---x       | Live-in, kill.</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00109" /><CodeLine lineNumber="109"><Highlight kind="comment">  ///  3 |       o---| Def, live-out.</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00110" /><CodeLine lineNumber="110"><Highlight kind="comment">  ///  4 |---x   o---| Live-in, kill, def, live-out. Counted by NumGapBlocks.</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00111" /><CodeLine lineNumber="111"><Highlight kind="comment">  ///  5 |---o---o---| Live-through with uses or defs.</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00112" /><CodeLine lineNumber="112"><Highlight kind="comment">  ///  6 |-----------| Live-through without uses. Counted by NumThroughBlocks.</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00113" /><CodeLine lineNumber="113"><Highlight kind="comment">  ///</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00114" /><CodeLine lineNumber="114"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// Two BlockInfo entries are created for template 4 One for the live-in</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00115" /><CodeLine lineNumber="115"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// segment, and one for the live-out segment. These entries look as if the</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00116" /><CodeLine lineNumber="116"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// block were split in the middle where the live range isn&#39;t live.</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00117" /><CodeLine lineNumber="117"><Highlight kind="comment">  ///</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00118" /><CodeLine lineNumber="118"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// Live-through blocks without any uses don&#39;t get BlockInfo entries. They</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00119" /><CodeLine lineNumber="119"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// are simply listed in ThroughBlocks instead.</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00120" /><CodeLine lineNumber="120"><Highlight kind="comment">  ///</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00121" /><CodeLine lineNumber="121" lineLink="/docs/api/structs/llvm/splitanalysis/blockinfo"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="keyword">struct </Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"><a href="/docs/api/structs/llvm/splitanalysis/blockinfo">BlockInfo</a> &#123;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00122" /><CodeLine lineNumber="122" lineLink="/docs/api/structs/llvm/splitanalysis/blockinfo/#a6d25ab70a5fda1310dad85ddb8ecaa22"><Highlight kind="normal">    <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/machinebasicblock">MachineBasicBlock</a> &#42;<a href="/docs/api/structs/llvm/splitanalysis/blockinfo/#a6d25ab70a5fda1310dad85ddb8ecaa22">MBB</a>;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00123" /><CodeLine lineNumber="123" lineLink="/docs/api/structs/llvm/splitanalysis/blockinfo/#afc1d576ff2321f8f3a604808be1b6f5b"><Highlight kind="normal">    <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/slotindex">SlotIndex</a> <a href="/docs/api/structs/llvm/splitanalysis/blockinfo/#afc1d576ff2321f8f3a604808be1b6f5b">FirstInstr</a>; </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">///&lt; First instr accessing current reg.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00124" /><CodeLine lineNumber="124" lineLink="/docs/api/structs/llvm/splitanalysis/blockinfo/#abaae5e7f00635019260dd4d2506e2b58"><Highlight kind="normal">    <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/slotindex">SlotIndex</a> <a href="/docs/api/structs/llvm/splitanalysis/blockinfo/#abaae5e7f00635019260dd4d2506e2b58">LastInstr</a>;  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">///&lt; Last instr accessing current reg.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00125" /><CodeLine lineNumber="125" lineLink="/docs/api/structs/llvm/splitanalysis/blockinfo/#a2ef80e68e8ebc6f8e778d811cc48f67f"><Highlight kind="normal">    <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/slotindex">SlotIndex</a> <a href="/docs/api/structs/llvm/splitanalysis/blockinfo/#a2ef80e68e8ebc6f8e778d811cc48f67f">FirstDef</a>;   </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">///&lt; First non-phi valno-&gt;def, or SlotIndex().</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00126" /><CodeLine lineNumber="126" lineLink="/docs/api/structs/llvm/splitanalysis/blockinfo/#a4c7b9375634dd9b55f130ae4c428475c"><Highlight kind="normal">    </Highlight><Highlight kind="keywordtype">bool</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> <a href="/docs/api/structs/llvm/splitanalysis/blockinfo/#a4c7b9375634dd9b55f130ae4c428475c">LiveIn</a>;          </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">///&lt; Current reg is live in.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00127" /><CodeLine lineNumber="127" lineLink="/docs/api/structs/llvm/splitanalysis/blockinfo/#a42e9b38c4f9bc0c0aca6f0c8c5cd1f80"><Highlight kind="normal">    </Highlight><Highlight kind="keywordtype">bool</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> <a href="/docs/api/structs/llvm/splitanalysis/blockinfo/#a42e9b38c4f9bc0c0aca6f0c8c5cd1f80">LiveOut</a>;         </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">///&lt; Current reg is live out.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>

<Link id="l00252" /><CodeLine lineNumber="252"><Highlight kind="comment">/// SplitEditor - Edit machine code and LiveIntervals for live range</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00253" /><CodeLine lineNumber="253"><Highlight kind="comment">/// splitting.</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00254" /><CodeLine lineNumber="254"><Highlight kind="comment">///</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00255" /><CodeLine lineNumber="255"><Highlight kind="comment">/// - Create a SplitEditor from a SplitAnalysis.</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00256" /><CodeLine lineNumber="256"><Highlight kind="comment">/// - Start a new live interval with openIntv.</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00257" /><CodeLine lineNumber="257"><Highlight kind="comment">/// - Mark the places where the new interval is entered using enterIntv&#42;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00258" /><CodeLine lineNumber="258"><Highlight kind="comment">/// - Mark the ranges where the new interval is used with useIntv&#42;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00259" /><CodeLine lineNumber="259"><Highlight kind="comment">/// - Mark the places where the interval is exited with exitIntv&#42;.</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00260" /><CodeLine lineNumber="260"><Highlight kind="comment">/// - Finish the current interval with closeIntv and repeat from 2</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00261" /><CodeLine lineNumber="261"><Highlight kind="comment">/// - Rewrite instructions with finish().</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00262" /><CodeLine lineNumber="262"><Highlight kind="comment">///</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00263" /><CodeLine lineNumber="263" lineLink="/docs/api/classes/llvm/spliteditor"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="keyword">class </Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"><a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/support/compiler-h/#a662e21bcce5c9c71b6cc511fa04f900f">LLVM&#95;LIBRARY&#95;VISIBILITY</a> <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/spliteditor/#a4a6b060244db6c0da73f9ba4ec523559">SplitEditor</a> &#123;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00264" /><CodeLine lineNumber="264"><Highlight kind="normal">  <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/splitanalysis">SplitAnalysis</a> &amp;SA;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00265" /><CodeLine lineNumber="265"><Highlight kind="normal">  <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/liveintervals">LiveIntervals</a> &amp;LIS;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00266" /><CodeLine lineNumber="266"><Highlight kind="normal">  <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/virtregmap">VirtRegMap</a> &amp;VRM;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00267" /><CodeLine lineNumber="267"><Highlight kind="normal">  <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/machineregisterinfo">MachineRegisterInfo</a> &amp;MRI;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00268" /><CodeLine lineNumber="268"><Highlight kind="normal">  <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/machinedominatortree">MachineDominatorTree</a> &amp;MDT;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00269" /><CodeLine lineNumber="269"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="keyword">const</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/targetinstrinfo">TargetInstrInfo</a> &amp;TII;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00270" /><CodeLine lineNumber="270"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="keyword">const</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/targetregisterinfo">TargetRegisterInfo</a> &amp;TRI;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00271" /><CodeLine lineNumber="271"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="keyword">const</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/machineblockfrequencyinfo">MachineBlockFrequencyInfo</a> &amp;MBFI;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00272" /><CodeLine lineNumber="272"><Highlight kind="normal">  <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/virtregauxinfo">VirtRegAuxInfo</a> &amp;VRAI;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00273" /><CodeLine lineNumber="273"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00274" /><CodeLine lineNumber="274"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="keyword">public</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal">:</Highlight><Highlight kind="comment"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00275" /><CodeLine lineNumber="275"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// ComplementSpillMode - Select how the complement live range should be</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00276" /><CodeLine lineNumber="276"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// created.  SplitEditor automatically creates interval 0 to contain</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00277" /><CodeLine lineNumber="277"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// anything that isn&#39;t added to another interval.  This complement interval</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00278" /><CodeLine lineNumber="278"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// can get quite complicated, and it can sometimes be an advantage to allow</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00279" /><CodeLine lineNumber="279"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// it to overlap the other intervals.  If it is going to spill anyway, no</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00280" /><CodeLine lineNumber="280"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// registers are wasted by keeping a value in two places at the same time.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00281" /><CodeLine lineNumber="281" lineLink="/docs/api/classes/llvm/spliteditor/#ad485b75a455867847a669a3f942cbcb7"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="keyword">enum</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/spliteditor/#ad485b75a455867847a669a3f942cbcb7">ComplementSpillMode</a> &#123;</Highlight><Highlight kind="comment"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00282" /><CodeLine lineNumber="282"><Highlight kind="comment">    /// SM&#95;Partition(Default) - Try to create the complement interval so it</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00283" /><CodeLine lineNumber="283"><Highlight kind="comment">    /// doesn&#39;t overlap any other intervals, and the original interval is</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00284" /><CodeLine lineNumber="284"><Highlight kind="comment">    /// partitioned.  This may require a large number of back copies and extra</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00285" /><CodeLine lineNumber="285"><Highlight kind="comment">    /// PHI-defs.  Only segments marked with overlapIntv will be overlapping.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00286" /><CodeLine lineNumber="286" lineLink="/docs/api/classes/llvm/spliteditor/#ad485b75a455867847a669a3f942cbcb7a5cd5c6b9f5402366a8e7a28a55925720"><Highlight kind="normal">    <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/spliteditor/#ad485b75a455867847a669a3f942cbcb7a5cd5c6b9f5402366a8e7a28a55925720">SM&#95;Partition</a>,</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00287" /><CodeLine lineNumber="287"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00288" /><CodeLine lineNumber="288"><Highlight kind="comment">    /// SM&#95;Size - Overlap intervals to minimize the number of inserted COPY</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00289" /><CodeLine lineNumber="289"><Highlight kind="comment">    /// instructions.  Copies to the complement interval are hoisted to their</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00290" /><CodeLine lineNumber="290"><Highlight kind="comment">    /// common dominator, so only one COPY is required per value in the</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00291" /><CodeLine lineNumber="291"><Highlight kind="comment">    /// complement interval.  This also means that no extra PHI-defs need to be</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00292" /><CodeLine lineNumber="292"><Highlight kind="comment">    /// inserted in the complement interval.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00293" /><CodeLine lineNumber="293" lineLink="/docs/api/classes/llvm/spliteditor/#ad485b75a455867847a669a3f942cbcb7ade36d2a249a7f767c968e8667190bc11"><Highlight kind="normal">    <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/spliteditor/#ad485b75a455867847a669a3f942cbcb7ade36d2a249a7f767c968e8667190bc11">SM&#95;Size</a>,</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00294" /><CodeLine lineNumber="294"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00295" /><CodeLine lineNumber="295"><Highlight kind="comment">    /// SM&#95;Speed - Overlap intervals to minimize the expected execution</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00296" /><CodeLine lineNumber="296"><Highlight kind="comment">    /// frequency of the inserted copies.  This is very similar to SM&#95;Size, but</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00297" /><CodeLine lineNumber="297"><Highlight kind="comment">    /// the complement interval may get some extra PHI-defs.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00298" /><CodeLine lineNumber="298" lineLink="/docs/api/classes/llvm/spliteditor/#ad485b75a455867847a669a3f942cbcb7a7bfb05c8742572ff98fd4f226bb0aede"><Highlight kind="normal">    <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/spliteditor/#ad485b75a455867847a669a3f942cbcb7a7bfb05c8742572ff98fd4f226bb0aede">SM&#95;Speed</a></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00299" /><CodeLine lineNumber="299"><Highlight kind="normal">  &#125;;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00300" /><CodeLine lineNumber="300"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00301" /><CodeLine lineNumber="301"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="keyword">private</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal">:</Highlight><Highlight kind="comment"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00302" /><CodeLine lineNumber="302"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// Edit - The current parent register and new intervals created.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>

<Link id="l00304" /><CodeLine lineNumber="304"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00305" /><CodeLine lineNumber="305"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// Index into Edit of the currently open interval.</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00306" /><CodeLine lineNumber="306"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// The index 0 is used for the complement, so the first interval started by</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00307" /><CodeLine lineNumber="307"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// openIntv will be 1</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00308" /><CodeLine lineNumber="308"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="keywordtype">unsigned</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> OpenIdx = 0;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00309" /><CodeLine lineNumber="309"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment"></Highlight></CodeLine>

<Link id="l00313" /><CodeLine lineNumber="313"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="keyword">using </Highlight><Highlight kind="normal">RegAssignMap = <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/intervalmap">IntervalMap&lt;SlotIndex, unsigned&gt;</a>;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00314" /><CodeLine lineNumber="314"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00315" /><CodeLine lineNumber="315"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// Allocator for the interval map. This will eventually be shared with</Highlight></CodeLine>

<Link id="l00317" /><CodeLine lineNumber="317"><Highlight kind="normal">  RegAssignMap::Allocator <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/codegen/regallocbasic-cpp/#ad5d00e1d77644d95847b9bf8da12b759">Allocator</a>;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00318" /><CodeLine lineNumber="318"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00319" /><CodeLine lineNumber="319"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// RegAssign - Map of the assigned register indexes.</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00320" /><CodeLine lineNumber="320"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// Edit.get(RegAssign.lookup(Idx)) is the register that should be live at</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00321" /><CodeLine lineNumber="321"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// Idx.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00322" /><CodeLine lineNumber="322"><Highlight kind="normal">  RegAssignMap RegAssign;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00323" /><CodeLine lineNumber="323"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00324" /><CodeLine lineNumber="324"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="keyword">using </Highlight><Highlight kind="normal">ValueForcePair = <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/pointerintpair">PointerIntPair&lt;VNInfo &#42;, 1&gt;</a>;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00325" /><CodeLine lineNumber="325"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="keyword">using </Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"><a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/valuemap">ValueMap</a> = <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/densemap">DenseMap&lt;std::pair&lt;unsigned, unsigned&gt;</a>, ValueForcePair&gt;;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00326" /><CodeLine lineNumber="326"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00327" /><CodeLine lineNumber="327"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// Values - keep track of the mapping from parent values to values in the new</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00328" /><CodeLine lineNumber="328"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// intervals. Given a pair (RegIdx, ParentVNI-&gt;id), Values contains:</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00329" /><CodeLine lineNumber="329"><Highlight kind="comment">  ///</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00330" /><CodeLine lineNumber="330"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// 1 No entry - the value is not mapped to Edit.get(RegIdx).</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00331" /><CodeLine lineNumber="331"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// 2 (Null, false) - the value is mapped to multiple values in</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00332" /><CodeLine lineNumber="332"><Highlight kind="comment">  ///    Edit.get(RegIdx).  Each value is represented by a minimal live range at</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00333" /><CodeLine lineNumber="333"><Highlight kind="comment">  ///    its def.  The full live range can be inferred exactly from the range</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00334" /><CodeLine lineNumber="334"><Highlight kind="comment">  ///    of RegIdx in RegAssign.</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00335" /><CodeLine lineNumber="335"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// 3 (Null, true).  As above, but the ranges in RegAssign are too large, and</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00336" /><CodeLine lineNumber="336"><Highlight kind="comment">  ///    the live range must be recomputed using ::extend().</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00337" /><CodeLine lineNumber="337"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// 4 (VNI, false) The value is mapped to a single new value.</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00338" /><CodeLine lineNumber="338"><Highlight kind="comment">  ///    The new value has no live ranges anywhere.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00339" /><CodeLine lineNumber="339"><Highlight kind="normal">  <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/valuemap">ValueMap</a> Values;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00340" /><CodeLine lineNumber="340"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00341" /><CodeLine lineNumber="341"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// LICalc - Cache for computing live ranges and SSA update.  Each instance</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00342" /><CodeLine lineNumber="342"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// can only handle non-overlapping live ranges, so use a separate</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00343" /><CodeLine lineNumber="343"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// LiveIntervalCalc instance for the complement interval when in spill mode.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>

<Link id="l00492" /><CodeLine lineNumber="492"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// leaveIntvAtTop - Leave the interval at the top of MBB.</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00493" /><CodeLine lineNumber="493"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// Add liveness from the MBB top to the copy.</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00494" /><CodeLine lineNumber="494"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// Return the end of the live range.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00495" /><CodeLine lineNumber="495"><Highlight kind="normal">  <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/slotindex">SlotIndex</a> leaveIntvAtTop(<a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/machinebasicblock">MachineBasicBlock</a> &amp;<a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/target/lib/target/arm/armslshardening-cpp/#a5958512eae2979bd2eb383977996a600">MBB</a>);</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00496" /><CodeLine lineNumber="496"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00497" /><CodeLine lineNumber="497"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// overlapIntv - Indicate that all instructions in range should use the open</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00498" /><CodeLine lineNumber="498"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// interval if End does not have tied-def usage of the register and in this</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00499" /><CodeLine lineNumber="499"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// case complement interval is used. Let the complement interval be live.</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00500" /><CodeLine lineNumber="500"><Highlight kind="comment">  ///</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00501" /><CodeLine lineNumber="501"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// This doubles the register pressure, but is sometimes required to deal with</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00502" /><CodeLine lineNumber="502"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// register uses after the last valid split point.</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00503" /><CodeLine lineNumber="503"><Highlight kind="comment">  ///</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00504" /><CodeLine lineNumber="504"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// The Start index should be a return value from a leaveIntv&#42; call, and End</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00505" /><CodeLine lineNumber="505"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// should be in the same basic block. The parent interval must have the same</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00506" /><CodeLine lineNumber="506"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// value across the range.</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00507" /><CodeLine lineNumber="507"><Highlight kind="comment">  ///</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00508" /><CodeLine lineNumber="508"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="keywordtype">void</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> overlapIntv(<a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/slotindex">SlotIndex</a> Start, <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/slotindex">SlotIndex</a> End);</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00509" /><CodeLine lineNumber="509"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00510" /><CodeLine lineNumber="510"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// finish - after all the new live ranges have been created, compute the</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00511" /><CodeLine lineNumber="511"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// remaining live range, and rewrite instructions to use the new registers.</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00512" /><CodeLine lineNumber="512"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// @param LRMap When not null, this vector will map each live range in Edit</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00513" /><CodeLine lineNumber="513"><Highlight kind="comment">  ///              back to the indices returned by openIntv.</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00514" /><CodeLine lineNumber="514"><Highlight kind="comment">  ///              There may be extra indices created by dead code elimination.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00515" /><CodeLine lineNumber="515"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="keywordtype">void</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> finish(<a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/smallvectorimpl">SmallVectorImpl&lt;unsigned&gt;</a> &#42;LRMap = </Highlight><Highlight kind="keyword">nullptr</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal">);</Highlight></CodeLine>

<Link id="l00523" /><CodeLine lineNumber="523"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// uses in a single block. This is intended to be used as part of a larger</Highlight></CodeLine>

<Link id="l00526" /><CodeLine lineNumber="526"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00527" /><CodeLine lineNumber="527"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// splitLiveThroughBlock - Split CurLI in the given block such that it</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00528" /><CodeLine lineNumber="528"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// enters the block in IntvIn and leaves it in IntvOut. There may be uses in</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00529" /><CodeLine lineNumber="529"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// the block, but they will be ignored when placing split points.</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00530" /><CodeLine lineNumber="530"><Highlight kind="comment">  ///</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00531" /><CodeLine lineNumber="531"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// @param MBBNum      Block number.</Highlight></CodeLine>

<Link id="l00533" /><CodeLine lineNumber="533"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// @param LeaveBefore When set, leave IntvIn before this point.</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00534" /><CodeLine lineNumber="534"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// @param IntvOut     Interval index leaving the block.</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00535" /><CodeLine lineNumber="535"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// @param EnterAfter  When set, enter IntvOut after this point.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00536" /><CodeLine lineNumber="536"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="keywordtype">void</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> splitLiveThroughBlock(</Highlight><Highlight kind="keywordtype">unsigned</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> MBBNum,</Highlight></CodeLine>

<Link id="l00539" /><CodeLine lineNumber="539"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00540" /><CodeLine lineNumber="540"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// splitRegInBlock - Split CurLI in the given block such that it enters the</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00541" /><CodeLine lineNumber="541"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// block in IntvIn and leaves it on the stack (or not at all). Split points</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00542" /><CodeLine lineNumber="542"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// are placed in a way that avoids putting uses in the stack interval. This</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00543" /><CodeLine lineNumber="543"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// may require creating a local interval when there is interference.</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00544" /><CodeLine lineNumber="544"><Highlight kind="comment">  ///</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00545" /><CodeLine lineNumber="545"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// @param BI          Block descriptor.</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00546" /><CodeLine lineNumber="546"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// @param IntvIn      Interval index entering the block. Not 0</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00547" /><CodeLine lineNumber="547"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// @param LeaveBefore When set, leave IntvIn before this point.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00548" /><CodeLine lineNumber="548"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="keywordtype">void</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> splitRegInBlock(</Highlight><Highlight kind="keyword">const</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> <a href="/docs/api/structs/llvm/splitanalysis/blockinfo">SplitAnalysis::BlockInfo</a> &amp;BI,</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00549" /><CodeLine lineNumber="549"><Highlight kind="normal">                       </Highlight><Highlight kind="keywordtype">unsigned</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> IntvIn, <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/slotindex">SlotIndex</a> LeaveBefore);</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00550" /><CodeLine lineNumber="550"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00551" /><CodeLine lineNumber="551"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// splitRegOutBlock - Split CurLI in the given block such that it enters the</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00552" /><CodeLine lineNumber="552"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// block on the stack (or isn&#39;t live-in at all) and leaves it in IntvOut.</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00553" /><CodeLine lineNumber="553"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// Split points are placed to avoid interference and such that the uses are</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00554" /><CodeLine lineNumber="554"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// not in the stack interval. This may require creating a local interval</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00555" /><CodeLine lineNumber="555"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// when there is interference.</Highlight></CodeLine>
